revised_title: Edmund Halley's Proposal to Determine the Age of the World through the Saltness of Lakes and the Ocean
tldr: Edmund Halley proposed that the age of the Earth could be determined by studying the salinity of lakes and the ocean. He observed that all lakes receive rivers and have no outlet, causing their waters to evaporate and become saltier over time. Halley suggested that a similar process occurs in the ocean, leading to an increase in salinity. By measuring the current salinity of lakes and the ocean, and comparing it to historical records, Halley believed that the age of the Earth could be estimated.
